div.l: And in þe Flore with nose ⁊and Mouþe to broke
They wallowe As done ij pygges in A poke
And vpp̄e they gone And downe agayne anon̄e
Tylle þat the Myller spurnede atte A Stone
And downe he Felle backwarde on his wyfe
That no þynge wyste of þis nyce stryfe
For sche was Falle Aslepe Alitulle wyghte
With Iohn þe clarke þat wakede hadde all nyghte
And with the Falle owte of her slepe sche brayde
Helpe holy crosse of bromeholme sche sayde
In manus tuas to the lorde I calle
Awake symonde þe Fende on me is Falle
My herte is broken helpe I Am butte dede
There lyeþe one vppon my wombe ⁊and vpp̄e my hede
Helpe symken For the False Clarkes Fyghte
This Iohn starte vppe As Faste as eủer he myghte
And graspede by the walles to And Fro
To Fynden A Staffe and Scherte vpp̄e allso
And knewe the estas bette þan dydde þat Iohn
And by the walle A Staffe sche Fonde Anon̄e
And saughe Alitulle schymerenge of A lyghte
For Atte an hole in Schone þe Moone brighte
And by þat lyghte Sche saughe hem boþe two
Butte Sykurlye sche nyste who was who
Butte as Sche saughe A whyte þynge in her eye
And Sche gan þis whyte þynge Aspye
Sche wende the clarke hadde werede A volipere
And with þe staffe Sche droughe Ay nere ⁊and nere
And wende han hadde this Aleyn atte Fulle
And Smote the Myller vppon the pyllede Sculle
That downe he goþe ⁊and cryeþe harrowe I deye
These clarkes bete hym well And lete hym lye
